physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.The subject 791 (Orders-in-Council) consists of two volumes, IOR/L/PS/10/28-29. The volumes are divided into 5 parts with parts 1, 2 and 3 comprising one volume, and parts 4 and 5 comprising the second volume

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 313; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional mixed foliation/pagination sequence is also present in parallel between ff 82-87; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The volume comprises three parts discussing Orders in Council:part 1 contains the Persian Coast and Islands Order in Council 1905 and 1907, with amendments and related correspondence between India Office officials;part 2 concerns the revised Rules of Court to cover the Table of Fees proposed under the 1907 Persian Coast and Islands Order in Council;part 3 contains correspondence between the Foreign Office and the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf regarding a proposed Bahrain Order in Council, and on the judicial powers exercised by the Political Agent at Bahrain on British subjects and foreigners in Bahrain, according to the 1907 Persian Coast and Islands Order in Council.The volume comprises parts 1, 2, and 3 of 3. Each part includes a divider which gives the subject and part numbers, year the subject file was opened, subject heading, and list of correspondence references contained in that part by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
